metadata.title: CVE-2020-27777 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the way RTAS handled memory accesses in userspace tokernel communication. On a locked down (usually due to Secure Boot) guestsystem running on top of PowerVM or KVM hypervisors (pseries platform) aroot like local user could use this flaw to further increase theirprivileges to that of a running kernel.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
